text: Transcription factors act in concert to induce lineage commitment towards Th1 , Th2 , or T regulatory ( Treg ) cells , and their counter - regulatory mechanisms were shown to be critical for polarization between Th1 and Th2 phenotypes .

text: Therefore , this study provides a new understanding of tolerance development , controlled by a type 2 immune response .

text: Specific immune responses against foreign or autologous antigens are driven by specialized epitope - specific T cells , whose numbers expand upon recognition of antigen found on professional antigen-presenting cells .

The subsequent maturation process involves the differentiation of certain T cell phenotypes such as pro-inflammatory cells ( Th1 , Th2 , Th17 ) or regulatory T ( Treg ) cells , which serve to keep the immune response in check .

The current study focuses on the role of two key transcription factors - <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> GATA3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - in controlling the commitment of these cells .

We demonstrate that the Th2 cytokine <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibits the induction of <extra_id_0> FOXP3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and thus inhibits the generation of inducible Treg cells .
